page.title: 07A FAMILY SUNDAY IN SHIPSTON
page.content: We interviewed our school secretary Mrs Eldridge about a typical family Sunday. Mr and Mrs Eldridge and their daughters Sarah aged 7 and Victoria aged 6 moved into a new house in Shipston-on-Stour in 1983. The family rise at 8.00 a.m.,a fraction later than on school days. After breakfast they go swimming.When they return, Mr Eldridge cleans the car,the children play and Mrs Eldridge prepares the lunch. At 2.30 p.m.,they go for a short walk.When they return home they work in the garden. The children have their baths at 5.00 p.m.Then they all have a picnic tea brought in on a trolley wheeled by the children.The children go to bed at 7.30 p.m. while their parents get things ready for Monday.
